definition: entrepot/transit (of goods)/(coll.) to deny/to go back on one's word
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: This may be related to investor speculation that the company has the intention of re-close.
sentences.chinese: 这可能与投资者猜测，该公司的转口打算关闭。

sentences.english: Entrepot trade was once one of the important economic pillars in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 转口贸易曾经是香港经济的重要支柱之一。

sentences.english: No enterprise may engage in transit trade of wastes.
sentences.chinese: 任何企业不得进行废物的转口贸易。

sentences.english: This set of measures shall not apply to transit trade.
sentences.chinese: 有关转口贸易管理，不适用本办法。

sentences.english: After the Singapore cargo is loaded, we'll start to load the cargo with transhipment at Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡货装完后，我们将开始装香港的转口货。

sentences.english: These Measures are applicable to the administration of transit trade.
sentences.chinese: 有关转口贸易管理，不适用本办法。

sentences.english: This section shall not apply to any goods in transit.
sentences.chinese: 本条之规定不适用于任何转口货品。

sentences.english: Rotterdam and Singapore are centers for entrop?t trade.
sentences.chinese: 鹿特丹和新加坡是转口贸易中心。

sentences.english: At least one of the two major parties will disappear or re-form.
sentences.chinese: 至少有一个两个主要政党将消失或转口的形式。

sentences.english: The Measures does not apply for transit trade.
sentences.chinese: 有关转口贸易管理，不适用本办法。

sentences.english: Jiangmen City Hong Kong is the most important export and re-export market.
sentences.chinese: 香港是江门市最主要的出口和转口贸易市场。

definition: to make a detour/to go by way of
pavement/sidewalk/shortcut/makeshift road
to diverge/to branch off the road/to change (the subject)
interruption/to interrupt (esp. talk)/to change the subject
subject (under discussion)/thread (of an argument)
to have second thoughts about sth/to think better of
topic under discussion/thread of discussion
slip of the tongue/indiscretion/to blurt out a secret
stern/grim/resolute/firm/unflinching/fundamental colors
to turn back/to put back/reversal/melodic inversion (in music)
to be on the verge of saying what is on one's mind
thread of discussion/topic
(polite) my husband
shut up/shut your mouth/stop talking
to blurt out without thinking (idiom)
to lower (one's voice)
